title: Drawing, "Sepulchral monument for Carlo Fontana", after 1795
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite
markings:
Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
Watermark: I [heart] BOUCHOT (?)
provenance: Ex collection: Giovanni Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Oblique view of an antique sarcophagus standing upon two steps, upon which pairs of children carry the Papal keys (at left), and the tiara (at right). The front of the sarcophagus bears the inscription: "LA STORIA.SCRISSE.DEL.VATICANO.TEMPIO./ IL.FONTANA.ARCHITETTO.E.CON.BRAVA./ IL.GLOBBO.VI.PRESENTO.CHE.SENZZA.ESEMPIO./ GRAN. TERMINE.FORMA.NELLA.SUA.ALTURA. In the center of the corner stands upon a base a globe with the inscription: CIMA.DEL./ TEMPIO.VATICANO./ IN.ROMA, and with an incense bowl upon four legs at its top. A woman stands beside at right, holding a compass in her left hand and evidently dictating to her companion who leans on an open book, in which she is writing, upon the globe. Bushes and trees are in the background. Framing strips below at left and above at right.
